title: Austrian Skiers Win Team Gold at Olympics
summary: Ariane Raedler and Katharina Huber from Austria won a gold medal in a new team skiing event at the Olympics. They raced together in a team combined event, where one skier does downhill and another does slalom, and their times are added up. Mikaela Shiffrin, a famous American skier with many wins, finished fourth and did not get a medal. Germany won silver, and the United States won bronze. Shiffrin still has more races to try for a medal. The event happened in Italy, and it was exciting to see new champions.

background_read: The Olympics are a big sports competition where athletes from many countries compete for medals. Skiing is a winter sport where people slide down snowy hills. In team events, skiers work together to win. Mikaela Shiffrin is known for winning many races, but sometimes even great athletes don't get medals. This story shows how new champions can emerge in sports.
Article_Structure: WHO: Ariane Raedler and Katharina Huber from Austria, Mikaela Shiffrin from the United States, and other skiers from Germany and the U.S.
WHAT: A team combined skiing event at the Olympics where Austria won gold, Germany silver, and the U.S. bronze, with Shiffrin placing fourth.
WHERE: Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy, at the Milan Cortina Olympic Games.
WHY: To report on the results of a new Olympic event and highlight Shiffrin's performance without a medal.

perspectives.description: Focuses on how Raedler and Huber, who haven't won World Cup races, became Olympic champions, showing that anyone can succeed on a big stage.
